alert.note: Alert for Riverside; San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 24 at 6:06PM PST until February 24 at 10:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 903 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following counties, Riverside and San Bernardino. * WHEN...Until 903 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 604 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. The heaviest rain is occurring north of Interstate 10, especially along the slopes where 0.30 to 0.50 inches of rain in an hour has been recorded. - Moderate to heavy rain will continue, which will lead to minor flooding across the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Riverside, San Bernardino, Fontana, Ontario, Rialto, Chino, Redlands, I-15 Through The Cajon Pass, Rancho Cucamonga and Chino Hills. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
